other_tests.findings: One slightly enlarged parathyroid gland was resected. Pathologically, the gland had normal histology.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After surgery, normocalcemia was obtained, although 2 weeks later the serum calcium had returned to the presurgery elevated levels.

other_tests.procedure_name: Direct sequence analysis of CASR gene
other_tests.findings: Heterozygous R227Q mutation identified in exon 4 of the CASR gene.
other_tests.changes_over_time: This mutation segregated with other affected family members.

other_tests.findings: Low calcium-to-creatinine clearance ratio led to a diagnosis of benign hypocalciuric hypercalcemia.
Both mutant receptors (R227Q and R227L) were expressed at a similar level to wild-type, demonstrating mature glycosylation.
Both mutants (R227Q and R227L) exhibited significant rightward shifts in their dose-response curves relative to wild-type.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The rightward shift was less marked for the R227Q mutant.
